segment.source: Use Set up School PCs app
segment.target: Use Set up School PCs app

segment.source: Learn how the Set up School PCs app works and how to use it.
segment.target: Learn how the Set up School PCs app works and how to use it.

segment.source: Use the Set up School PCs app (Preview)
segment.target: Use the Set up School PCs app (Preview)

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10 Insider Preview
segment.target: Windows 10 Insider Preview

segment.source: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.
segment.target: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.

segment.source: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.
segment.target: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.

segment.source: Teachers and IT administrators can use the Set up School PCs app to quickly set up computers for students.
segment.target: Teachers and IT administrators can use the Set up School PCs app to quickly set up computers for students.

segment.source: A computer set up using the app is tailored to provide students with the tools they need for learning while removing apps and features that they don't need.
segment.target: A computer set up using the app is tailored to provide students with the tools they need for learning while removing apps and features that they don't need.

segment.source: Run app, turn on PC, insert USB key
segment.target: Run app, turn on PC, insert USB key

segment.source: What does this app do?
segment.target: What does this app do?

segment.source: The Set up School PCs app helps you set up new computers running Windows 10, version 1607.
segment.target: The Set up School PCs app helps you set up new computers running Windows 10, version 1607.

segment.source: Some benefits of using this app to set up your students' PCs:
segment.target: Some benefits of using this app to set up your students' PCs:

segment.source: A computer set up this way is tailored to provide students with the tools they need for learning while removing apps and features that they don't need.
segment.target: A computer set up this way is tailored to provide students with the tools they need for learning while removing apps and features that they don't need.

segment.source: Places tiles for OneNote, Office 365 web apps, Sway, and Microsoft Classroom on the Start menu
segment.target: Places tiles for OneNote, Office 365 web apps, Sway, and Microsoft Classroom on the Start menu

segment.source: Installs OneDrive for cloud-based documents and places it on the Start menu and taskbar
segment.target: Installs OneDrive for cloud-based documents and places it on the Start menu and taskbar

segment.source: Sets Microsoft Edge as the default browser
segment.target: Sets Microsoft Edge as the default browser

segment.source: Uninstalls apps not specific to education, such as Solitaire and Sports
segment.target: Uninstalls apps not specific to education, such as Solitaire and Sports

segment.source: Turns off Offers and tips
segment.target: Turns off Offers and tips

segment.source: Prevents students from adding personal Microsoft accounts to the computer
segment.target: Prevents students from adding personal Microsoft accounts to the computer

segment.source: Significantly improves how fast students sign-in.
segment.target: Significantly improves how fast students sign-in.

segment.source: The app connects the PCs to your school’s cloud so IT can manage them (optional).
segment.target: The app connects the PCs to your school’s cloud so IT can manage them (optional).

segment.source: Windows 10 automatically manages accounts no matter how many students use the PC.
segment.target: Windows 10 automatically manages accounts no matter how many students use the PC.

segment.source: Keeps computers up-to-date without interfering with class time using Windows Update and maintenance hours (by default, 12 AM).
segment.target: Keeps computers up-to-date without interfering with class time using Windows Update and maintenance hours (by default, 12 AM).

segment.source: Customizes the sign-in screen to support students with IDs and temporary users.
segment.target: Customizes the sign-in screen to support students with IDs and temporary users.

segment.source: Locks down the computer to prevent mischievous activity:
segment.target: Locks down the computer to prevent mischievous activity:

segment.source: Prevents students from installing apps
segment.target: Prevents students from installing apps

segment.source: Prevents students from removing the computer from the school's device management system
segment.target: Prevents students from removing the computer from the school's device management system

segment.source: Prevents students from removing the Set up School PCs settings
segment.target: Prevents students from removing the Set up School PCs settings

segment.source: Tips for success
segment.target: Tips for success

segment.source: Run the app at work: For the best results, run the Set up School PCs app on your work device connected to your school's network.
segment.target: Run the app at work: For the best results, run the Set up School PCs app on your work device connected to your school's network.

segment.source: That way the app can gather accurate information about your wireless networks and cloud subscriptions.
segment.target: That way the app can gather accurate information about your wireless networks and cloud subscriptions.

segment.source: Note: Don't use Set up Schools PCs app for PCs that must connect to enterprise networks or to open wi-fi networks that require the user to accept Terms of Use.
segment.target: Note: Don't use Set up Schools PCs app for PCs that must connect to enterprise networks or to open wi-fi networks that require the user to accept Terms of Use.

segment.source: Apply to new computers: The setup file that the Set up School PCs app creates should be used on new computers that haven't been set up for accounts yet.
segment.target: Apply to new computers: The setup file that the Set up School PCs app creates should be used on new computers that haven't been set up for accounts yet.

segment.source: If you apply the setup file to a computer that has already been set up, existing accounts and data might be lost.
segment.target: If you apply the setup file to a computer that has already been set up, existing accounts and data might be lost.

segment.source: Warning: Only use the setup file on computers that you want to configure and lock down for students.
segment.target: Warning: Only use the setup file on computers that you want to configure and lock down for students.

segment.source: After you apply the setup file to a computer, the computer must be reset to remove the settings.
segment.target: After you apply the setup file to a computer, the computer must be reset to remove the settings.

segment.source: Turn on student PCs and stay on first screen: The computer must be on this screen when you insert the USB key.
segment.target: Turn on student PCs and stay on first screen: The computer must be on this screen when you insert the USB key.

segment.source: The first screen to set up a new PC
segment.target: The first screen to set up a new PC

segment.source: If you have gone past this screen, you may have to reset your PC to start over.
segment.target: If you have gone past this screen, you may have to reset your PC to start over.

segment.source: To reset your PC after you have completed the first run experience, go to SettingsUpdate & securityRecoveryReset this PC.
segment.target: To reset your PC after you have completed the first run experience, go to SettingsUpdate & securityRecoveryReset this PC.

segment.source: Use more than one USB key: If you are setting up multiple PCs, you can set them up at the same time.
segment.target: Use more than one USB key: If you are setting up multiple PCs, you can set them up at the same time.

segment.source: Just run the Set up School PCs app again and save the same settings to another key.
segment.target: Just run the Set up School PCs app again and save the same settings to another key.

segment.source: That way you can run set up on more than one PC at once.
segment.target: That way you can run set up on more than one PC at once.

segment.source: Create three keys and you can run it on three PCs at once, etc.
segment.target: Create three keys and you can run it on three PCs at once, etc.

segment.source: Start fresh: If the PC has already been set up and you want to return to the first-run-experience to apply a new package, go to SettingsUpdate & securityRecoveryReset this PC.
segment.target: Start fresh: If the PC has already been set up and you want to return to the first-run-experience to apply a new package, go to SettingsUpdate & securityRecoveryReset this PC.

segment.source: Keep it clean: We strongly recommend that IT avoid changes to policies unless absolutely necessary, as any changes can impair performance and sign-in time.
segment.target: Keep it clean: We strongly recommend that IT avoid changes to policies unless absolutely necessary, as any changes can impair performance and sign-in time.

segment.source: Get more information at Set up School PCs app technical reference.
segment.target: Get more information at Set up School PCs app technical reference.

segment.source: Set up School PCs app step-by-step
segment.target: Set up School PCs app step-by-step

segment.source: What you need:
segment.target: What you need:

segment.source: The Set up School PCs app, installed on your work computer, connected to your school's network
segment.target: The Set up School PCs app, installed on your work computer, connected to your school's network

segment.source: A USB drive, 1 GB or larger
segment.target: A USB drive, 1 GB or larger

segment.source: Create the setup file in the app
segment.target: Create the setup file in the app

segment.source: The Set up School PCs app guides you through the configuration choices for the student PCs.
segment.target: The Set up School PCs app guides you through the configuration choices for the student PCs.

segment.source: Open the Set up School PCs app and select Start.
segment.target: Open the Set up School PCs app and select Start.

segment.source: select start
segment.target: select start

segment.source: Choose No to require students to sign in only with an account, or choose Yes to allow students to use the PC without an account too, and then select Next.
segment.target: Choose No to require students to sign in only with an account, or choose Yes to allow students to use the PC without an account too, and then select Next.

segment.source: account required?
segment.target: account required?

segment.source: Choose a Wi-Fi network from the list and then select Next, or choose Manually connect to a wireless network to enter the network information yourself.
segment.target: Choose a Wi-Fi network from the list and then select Next, or choose Manually connect to a wireless network to enter the network information yourself.

segment.source: choose network
segment.target: choose network

segment.source: For a manual network connection, enter the network name, security type, and password (if required), and then select Next.
segment.target: For a manual network connection, enter the network name, security type, and password (if required), and then select Next.

segment.source: enter network information
segment.target: enter network information

segment.source: Insert a USB drive, select it in the app, and then select Save.
segment.target: Insert a USB drive, select it in the app, and then select Save.

segment.source: select usb drive
segment.target: select usb drive

segment.source: Apply the setup file to PCs
segment.target: Apply the setup file to PCs

segment.source: The setup file on your USB drive is named , which is a provisioning package.
segment.target: The setup file on your USB drive is named , which is a provisioning package.

segment.source: A provisioning package is a method for applying settings to Windows 10.
segment.target: A provisioning package is a method for applying settings to Windows 10.

segment.source: When Windows 10 refers to package, it means your setup file, and when it refers to provisioning, it means applying the setup file to the computer.
segment.target: When Windows 10 refers to package, it means your setup file, and when it refers to provisioning, it means applying the setup file to the computer.

segment.source: Start with a computer on the first-run setup screen.
segment.target: Start with a computer on the first-run setup screen.

segment.source: If the PC has gone past this screen, reset the PC to start over.
segment.target: If the PC has gone past this screen, reset the PC to start over.

segment.source: To reset the PC, go to SettingsUpdate & securityRecoveryReset this PC.
segment.target: To reset the PC, go to SettingsUpdate & securityRecoveryReset this PC.

segment.source: The first screen to set up a new PC
segment.target: The first screen to set up a new PC

segment.source: Insert the USB drive.
segment.target: Insert the USB drive.

segment.source: Windows Setup will recognize the drive and ask if you want to set up the device.
segment.target: Windows Setup will recognize the drive and ask if you want to set up the device.

segment.source: Select Set up.
segment.target: Select Set up.

segment.source: Set up device?
segment.target: Set up device?

segment.source: The next screen asks you to select a provisioning source.
segment.target: The next screen asks you to select a provisioning source.

segment.source: Select Removable Media and tap Next.
segment.target: Select Removable Media and tap Next.

segment.source: Provision this device
segment.target: Provision this device

segment.source: Select and tap Next.
segment.target: Select and tap Next.

segment.source: Choose a package
segment.target: Choose a package

segment.source: Select Yes, add it.
segment.target: Select Yes, add it.

segment.source: Do you trust this package?
segment.target: Do you trust this package?

segment.source: Read and accept the Microsoft Software License Terms.
segment.target: Read and accept the Microsoft Software License Terms.

segment.source: Sign in
segment.target: Sign in

segment.source: Select Use Express settings.
segment.target: Select Use Express settings.

segment.source: Get going fast
segment.target: Get going fast

segment.source: If the PC doesn't use a volume license, you'll see the Who owns this PC? screen.
segment.target: If the PC doesn't use a volume license, you'll see the Who owns this PC? screen.

segment.source: Select My work or school owns it and tap Next.
segment.target: Select My work or school owns it and tap Next.

segment.source: Who owns this PC?
segment.target: Who owns this PC?

segment.source: On the Choose how you'll connect screen, select Join Azure AD and tap Next.
segment.target: On the Choose how you'll connect screen, select Join Azure AD and tap Next.

segment.source: Connect to Azure AD
segment.target: Connect to Azure AD

segment.source: Your last step is to sign in.
segment.target: Your last step is to sign in.

segment.source: Use your Azure AD or Office 365 account and password.
segment.target: Use your Azure AD or Office 365 account and password.

segment.source: When you see the progress ring, you can remove the USB drive.
segment.target: When you see the progress ring, you can remove the USB drive.

segment.source: Sign in
segment.target: Sign in

segment.source: That's it!
segment.target: That's it!

segment.source: Sign out and the computer is now ready for students.
segment.target: Sign out and the computer is now ready for students.

segment.source: Learn more
segment.target: Learn more

segment.source: See Technical reference for the Set up School PCs app for prerequisites and provisioning details.
segment.target: See Technical reference for the Set up School PCs app for prerequisites and provisioning details.
